children: A 71-year-old woman is evaluated for a chronic deformity of the left great toe associated with occasional pain. No other joints are involved.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient has a bunion (hallux). Bunion deformity is diagnosed clinically as a lateral deviation of the great toe at the first metatarsal. The nail of the toe may also face medially secondary to rotation of the toe. Bunions can lead to pain, first metatarsal phalangeal joint osteoarthritis, and bursitis characterized by erythema and warmth overlying the joint, as seen in this patient.
